titleStmt.title: Description of Free Library of Philadelphia Lewis O 82: Futūḥ al-Ḥaramayn.

licence.#text: These images and the content of Rare Book Department Lewis O 82: Futūḥ al-Ḥaramayn. are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Public Domain Mark page for usage details, http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/.

To the extent possible under law, Free Library of Philadelphia, Special Collections has waived all copyright and related or neighboring rights to this metadata about Rare Book Department Lewis O 82: Futūḥ al-Ḥaramayn.. This work is published from: United States. For a summary of CC0, see https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/. Legal code: https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/legalcode.

note: Catalog entry, lot 734, pasted into front inside cover with "Sotheby's Sale 7/25/1917, £3" written in pencil underneath.
Signature of H. Mohammad in blue ink (f. 1r).

msContents.summary: Copy, somewhat damaged by worms, of a poem describing the holy cities of Mecca and Medina and some practices and customs of the pilgrimage; illustrated with 12 simple drawings, chiefly in blue, red, green.

name.#text: Free Library of Philadelphia. Rare Book Department. John Frederick Lewis Collection of Oriental Manuscripts

supportDesc.extent: i, 36 leaves : 152 x 90 (100 x 50) mm bound to 152 x 95 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation added in pencil, upper left recto; catchwords every verso, lower left.

layoutDesc.layout: 15 lines, chiefly in two columns; border-ruled.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in nastaʻlīq in black ink; pointed.

decoNote: Simple illuminated headpiece in gold and blue (f. 1v); textblock is border-ruled in gold, black, and blue; the columns are divided by two gold rules; rubrications in red and blue; 12 simple line drawings of places in and around the holy cities, chiefly in red, blue, and green (f. 14v, 20r, 23r, 23v, 29r, 29v, 30r, 31r, 33r, 34r, 34v, 35v).

binding.p: Bound in blue brocade with leaf patterns; plain, white, laid paper pastedowns.

origin.p: Copy completed in the year 974 A.H. (1566 or 1567) by Uvays ibn Muḥammad al-Haravī (f. 36r).

provenance: Sold at Sotheby's 25 July 1917, lot 734 (note in pencil, inside front cover).
Formerly owned by John Frederick Lewis.
